references.paper_title: On the utility of learning about humans for human-ai coordination
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the work presented, introducing the Overcooked AI environment and highlighting the limitations of prior HMT approaches.

references.paper_title: Collaborating with humans without human data
references.reason: This paper offers a comparative approach to the authors' work, proposing Fictitious Co-Play as an alternative HMT methodology.

references.paper_title: The utility of explainable AI in ad hoc human-machine teaming
references.reason: This paper, also by one of the authors, explores the use of explainable AI in HMT, a key theme in the current work.

references.paper_title: Globally optimal fuzzy decision trees for classification and regression
references.reason: This paper provides the foundation for the IDCT architecture, introducing differentiable decision trees.

references.paper_title: Stop explaining black box machine learning models for high stakes decisions and use interpretable models instead
references.reason: This highly influential paper advocates for the use of interpretable models in high-stakes decision-making, a key motivation for this work.
